musicRepresentation

Class ABCHeader

  • java.lang.Object
    • musicRepresentation.ABCHeader

  • public class ABCHeader
extends java.lang.Object
    This class stores basic information about an .abc music. It's an immutable class.
    Author:
    Nicholas M. Mizoguchi

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ABCHeader(java.lang.String title, java.lang.String composer, int beatsPerMinute, double bpmNoteLength, int ticksPerBeat, double whatNoteGetsTheBeat, int beatsPerMeasure, double defaultNoteLength, java.lang.String key)
      Creates an ABCHeader object by informing all its attributes.

    • Method Detail

      • getBeatsPerMinute

        public int getBeatsPerMinute()
        Gives the information of how many beats per minute of the music that Header represents. Good to remember that the representation of bpm is in the bpmNoteLength time.
        Returns:
        beatsPerMinute which is always an integer.

      • getBpmNoteLength

        public double getBpmNoteLength()
        Gives the information of what note is the beat default. For instance, if the bpm is 60 and the bpmNoteLength is 1/4 we will play 1 quarter note per second.
        Returns:
        beatsPerMinute which is always an integer.

      • getTicksPerBeat

        public int getTicksPerBeat()
        Gives the information of how many ticks per beat of the music that Header represents. The value of ticksPerBeat is defined such that the smallest note played is still an integer number, in relation to number of ticks. It covers really short beats and triplets (least common divisor).
        Returns:
        beatsPerMinute which is always an integer.

      • getTitle

        public java.lang.String getTitle()
        Gives the Title of the piece of music ABCHeader represents
        Returns:
        the title String itself.

      • getComposer

        public java.lang.String getComposer()
        Gives the Composer of the piece of music ABCHeader represents
        Returns:
        the composer String itself.

      • getBeatsPerMeasure

        public int getBeatsPerMeasure()
        Gives the denominator of the Meter.
        Returns:
        an integer that represents how many beats (of type NoteLength) we have per measure.

      • getWhatNoteGetsTheBeat

        public double getWhatNoteGetsTheBeat()
        Gives the fraction that represents what note gets the time of a beat. For instance, a quarter note is represented by 0.25
        Returns:
        a double that represents the fraction.

      • getDefaultNoteLength

        public double getDefaultNoteLength()
        Gives the default note length of the piece. It is represented as a double. For instance, a quarter note is represented by 0.25
        Returns:
        a double that represents the default note length.

      • getKeySignature

        public KeySignature getKeySignature()
        Gives an object that represents the key signature.
        Returns:
        KeySignature object that represents the signature of the piece.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a string that represents the header (formated)
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
